Comment.Language: Let the fifth priest light the fifth lamp and say the fifth prayer.

Text.Language: Tenseph~mot n~totk P[oic Vnou] n~te nijom: e~jen hwb niben e~takaitou: je n~yok qen peknai akeroikonomin m~penwnq: n~yok pe piref]c~bw: n~yok pe pireftal[o.
We thank You, O Lord God of hosts, for all things You have done, for You in Your mercy order our life. You are the Teacher, You are the Healer.

Matal[o m~pekbwk (nim) e~bol qen nefswni: ouoh matoujof e~bolha pethwou efouoj: n~tefero~mologin hwf m~peknai: ouoh n~tef]w~ou nak nem peklaoc: qen tekekk~l/cia~ n~nie~hoou t/rou n~te pefwnq.

Heal Your servant (...) from his diseases, and cleanse him from all evil, that he may rise up whole, and himself praise Your mercy, and give glory to You with Your people in Your Church all the days of his life.
